alert.note: Alert for Kingfisher; Logan (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 12 at 9:11AM CDT until July 13 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Cimarron River near Dover affecting Kingfisher and Logan Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Cimarron River near Dover. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Near bankfull conditions exist along the river through Kingfisher County and into western Logan County. Some oilfield equipment in low bottomlands may be isolated for a short time. Sandpit operations near Dover may be affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 15.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 17.0 feet. - Forecast...The Cimarron River is expected to fall. - Action stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/oun. The next statement will be issued this evening at 915 PM CDT.
